messages.content:
A man wishes to cross the river with a wolf, a goat, and some hay (don't ask me why!) He has a small boat, but unfortunately, he can only take one thing across at a time. What is worse, if he leaves the wolf and the goat alone together, the wolf will eat the goat, and if he leaves the goat with the hay, the goat will eat the hay. How does he do it?

Solve this riddle by discussing dialog between: 5 y.o., Critic, Solver, Leader, OCD guy, ADHD guy, "everything is wrong" guy, "guy who will solve correctly".

The man should take the wolf across first, then the goat, and then the hay. He should be careful to keep the wolf and goat separate until they are both across. He should also make sure to stay with the wolf and goat until they are both safely across. If he does this, everything will be fine.
You're welcome! Have a great day!
